title: Pak News Channel Reports Fake News That Sikh Regiment Refused To Fight For India
subtitle: Major Gaurav Arya (Retrd), Consulting editor for strategic affairs at Republic TV took to Twitter stating that the screenshot was fake.
author: www.boomlive.in
vclaim:
Pakistani news channel 'Abb Takk' claimed on March 5, 2019 that the Indian Army's 21 Sikh Regiment refused to fight for India.

While reporting, Abb Takk quoted Twitter user Gurmeet Kaur's tweet stating the claim that '21 Sikh regiment refused to fight for India' with a screenshot of Republic TV purporting to report it.

Click here to view, and here for an archive.

The tweet went viral with many Pakistani social media users falling for it and sharing it.

Click to here view, and here for an archive.

BOOM analysed the screenshot and found it to be photoshopped as the text seems superimposed.

Additionally, Republic TV did not report any such news at 4:49 pm either on March 3, or March 4, 2019.

Major Gaurav Arya ( ), Consulting editor for strategic affairs at Republic TV took to Twitter stating that the screenshot was fake.

BOOM also found that Abb Takk had deleted their article after Twitter users called it out.

Additional Directorate General of Public Information (ADG PI) of the Indian Army tweeted out alerting people to be aware of false & malicious tweets being spread against Army units.
